title: Christmas trivia; The ten-day quiz: part 6
text:
Set 11Which legendary drummer died at the age of 80 last year?Which heiress was kidnapped by the Symbionese Liberation Army in 1974?Which scientist won the Nobel peace prize as well as a Nobel for chemistry?Which 1950s US sitcom was voted the best TV show of all time in a 2012 poll?Which rock festival was the subject of a song written by Joni Mitchell?What theme connects these answers?

Set 12What do vexillologists study?Who was nominated as best supporting actress for her role in the film “Good Will Hunting”?In what location did Eva Braun get married in April 1945?Which animated characters are the “rescue rangers” who are the focus of a new Disney film?What was the code name of the Apollo 11 lunar module?What theme connects these answers?

…

If you missed the questions yesterday, you can read them here. And these are the answers to yesterday's questions:

Set 9: Copenhagen, Berkeley, Poland, Stockholm and Tennessee.

They all had elements named after them: Hafnium (after Hafnia, the Latin name for Copenhagen), Berkelium, Polonium, Holmium (after Holmia, the Latin name for Stockholm) and Tennessine.

Set 10: Johnny Ray, Graham Chapman, William Booth, Oswald the lucky rabbit and Cassius Clay.

They all share names with assassins: James Earl Ray (Martin Luther King), Mark Chapman (John Lennon), John Wilkes Booth (Abraham Lincoln), Lee Harvey Oswald (Jack Kennedy) and Cassius (Julius Caesar).
